It belongs to the family Monotropaceae and is characterized by its unique, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in shaded, moist environments, often growing under the canopy of dense forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Monotrema flavum is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
